DOC.brief_summary: This is a randomized controlled study that will place patients into a "choice" and a "no choice" group. The choice group will be able to choose between receiving 100 mcg or 200 mcg intrathecal morphine. The no choice group will be randomized to receive either 100 mcg or 200 mcg of intrathecal morphine. Following casarean delivery, pain scores will be measured at 3, 6, 12, 24, and 36 hours.
DOC.brief_title: Influence of Patient Choice of Intrathecal Morphine on Post-cesarean Delivery Pain.
DOC.detailed_description: This randomised controlled study will include pre-operative screening with a 2 simple questionnaires and the patient will be randomised into a "choice" and "no choice" groups. The group with the choice will be offered 2 different doses of intrathecal morphine (100, 200 mcg) which they can decide on after being given a standard script explaining advantages and disadvantages of each dose. Following cesarean section patients will be followed up at 3, 6, 12, 24, 36, 48 hours following spinal injection to assess severity of pain, time to first analgesia, total analgesia requirements, treatment of nausea, vomiting and pruritus.
DOC.criteria: Women age 1850 with singleton, term gestation fetuses and scheduled for their 1st, 2nd, or 3rd elective CS (not in labor) will be included. Patient refusal.
